when_to_say: When greeting someone during the day
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (Konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?
さようなら、またね (Sayounara, mata ne) - Goodbye, see you later.
ありがとう、助かりました (Arigatou, tasukarimashita) - Thank you, you helped me.

when_to_say: When apologizing or getting someone's attention
example: すみません、遅れました (Sumimasen, okuremashita) - Excuse me, I am late.
はい、それは正しいです (Hai, sore wa tadashii desu) - Yes, that is correct.
いいえ、そうではありません (Iie, sou de wa arimasen) - No, that's not the case.

when_to_say: When greeting someone in the morning
example: おはようございます、今日はいい天気ですね (Ohayou gozaimasu, kyou wa ii tenki desu ne) - Good morning, the weather is nice today.

when_to_say: When greeting someone in the evening
example: こんばんは、お元気ですか？ (Konbanwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Good evening, how are you?
おやすみなさい、明日会いましょう (Oyasumi nasai, ashita aimashou) - Good night, let's meet tomorrow.
どういたしまして、気にしないでください (Dou itashimashite, ki ni shinaide kudasai) - You're welcome, don't mention it.
それは何ですか？ (Sore wa nandesuka?) - What is that?
駅はどこですか？ (Eki wa doko desuka?) - Where is the station?
あなたはいつ来ますか？ (Anata wa itsu kimasu ka?) - When are you coming?
どうしてここに来たのですか？ (Doushite koko ni kita no desuka?) - Why did you come here?
誰が来ますか？ (Dare ga kimasu ka?) - Who is coming?
何時に会いましょうか？ (Nanji ni aimashou ka?) - What time shall we meet?
朝ごはんを食べます (Asagohan o tabemasu) - I eat breakfast.
お茶を飲みます (Ocha o nomimasu) - I drink tea.

when_to_say: When talking about seeing or looking at something
example: 映画を見ます (Eiga o mimasu) - I watch movies.

when_to_say: When talking about listening or asking
example: 音楽を聞きます (Ongaku o kikimasu) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: When talking about speaking or talking
example: 日本語を話します (Nihongo o hanashimasu) - I speak Japanese.
学校に行きます (Gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school.
友達が家に来ます (Tomodachi ga ie ni kimasu) - My friend is coming to my house.

when_to_say: When talking about returning home or going back to a place
example: 今日は早く帰ります (Kyou wa hayaku kaerimasu) - I will go home early today.
朝ごはんを食べます (Asagohan o tabemasu) - I eat breakfast.
お茶を飲みます (Ocha o nomimasu) - I drink tea.
景色を見るのが好きです (Keshiki o miru no ga suki desu) - I like to see the scenery.
手紙を書きます (Tegami o kakimasu) - I write a letter.
電話で話します (Denwa de hanashimasu) - I talk on the phone.
毎日日本語を勉強します (Mainichi nihongo o benkyou shimasu) - I study Japanese every day.
公園で遊びます (Kouen de asobimasu) - I play at the park.
私は夜に寝ます (Watashi wa yoru ni nemasu) - I sleep at night.

meaning: To wake up / To get up
when_to_say: When talking about waking up or getting up
example: 私は朝7時に起きます (Watashi wa asa shichi-ji ni okimasu) - I wake up at 7 AM.
私は新しい車を買いました (Watashi wa atarashii kuruma o kaimashita) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: When talking about seeing or looking at something
example: 映画を見に行きます (Eiga o mi ni ikimasu) - I am going to watch a movie.
ジュースを飲みます (Juusu o nomimasu) - I drink juice.

when_to_say: When talking about teaching or instructing
example: 私は英語を教えます (Watashi wa eigo o oshiemasu) - I teach English.
日本語を勉強します (Nihongo o benkyou shimasu) - I study Japanese.

when_to_say: When talking about making or creating something
example: 私はケーキを作ります (Watashi wa keeki o tsukurimasu) - I make a cake.
公園を歩きます (Kouen o arukimasu) - I walk in the park.
友達が家に来ます (Tomodachi ga ie ni kimasu) - My friend is coming to my house.
新聞を読みます (Shinbun o yomimasu) - I read the newspaper.
私は朝8時に起きます (Watashi wa asa hachi-ji ni okimasu) - I wake up at 8 AM.
私は毎晩10時に寝ます (Watashi wa maiban juu-ji ni nemasu) - I sleep at 10 PM every night.

meaning: To rest / To take a break
when_to_say: When talking about resting or taking a break
example: 今日は休みます (Kyou wa yasumimasu) - I will take a break today.

when_to_say: When talking about driving a vehicle
example: 私は車を運転します (Watashi wa kuruma o untenshimasu) - I drive a car.
昼ごはんを食べます (Hirugohan o tabemasu) - I eat lunch.
水を飲みます (Mizu o nomimasu) - I drink water.

when_to_say: When talking about showing something to someone
example: 写真を見せます (Shashin o misemasu) - I show a picture.

when_to_say: When talking about thinking or pondering
example: この問題を考えます (Kono mondai o kangaemasu) - I think about this problem.

when_to_say: When talking about having or holding something
example: 私はバッグを持っています (Watashi wa baggu o motteimasu) - I have a bag.
会議で話します (Kaigi de hanashimasu) - I speak at the meeting.

when_to_say: When talking about asking or listening
example: 質問を聞きます (Shitsumon o kikimasu) - I ask a question.
新しい車を買います (Atarashii kuruma o kaimasu) - I buy a new car.
携帯電話を使います (Keitai denwa o tsukaimasu) - I use my cell phone.
写真を取ります (Shashin o torimasu) - I take a photo.

when_to_say: When talking about entering a place
example: 部屋に入ります (Heya ni hairimasu) - I enter the room.

when_to_say: When talking about exiting a place
example: 家を出ます (Ie o demasu) - I leave the house.
鳥が空を飛びます (Tori ga sora o tobimasu) - The bird flies in the sky.
海で泳ぎます (Umi de oyogimasu) - I swim in the sea.

when_to_say: When talking about riding or getting on a vehicle
example: 電車に乗ります (Densha ni norimasu) - I ride the train.
公園を歩きます (Kouen o arukimasu) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: When talking about something being heard
example: 音が聞こえます (Oto ga kikoemasu) - I can hear the sound.

when_to_say: When talking about something being visible
example: 山が見えます (Yama ga miemasu) - I can see the mountain.
私は彼を知っています (Watashi wa kare o shitteimasu) - I know him.
宿題を忘れました (Shukudai o wasuremashita) - I forgot my homework.

when_to_say: When talking about searching or looking for something
example: 鍵を探しています (Kagi o sagashiteimasu) - I am looking for my keys.

when_to_say: When talking about waiting for someone or something
example: バスを待ちます (Basu o machimasu) - I wait for the bus.
友達に会います (Tomodachi ni aimasu) - I meet my friend.

when_to_say: When talking about talking to someone
example: 先生と話します (Sensei to hanashimasu) - I talk to the teacher.
毎朝公園を歩きます (Maiasa kouen o arukimasu) - I walk in the park every morning.

when_to_say: When talking about someone coming or arriving
example: 彼は今、家に来ます (Kare wa ima, ie ni kimasu) - He is coming home now.

when_to_say: When asking or listening to something
example: 質問を聞きます (Shitsumon o kikimasu) - I ask a question.

when_to_say: When talking about looking at or observing something
example: 映画を見ます (Eiga o mimasu) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: When talking about leaving a place
example: 家を出ます (Ie o demasu) - I leave the house.
この問題が分かります (Kono mondai ga wakarimasu) - I understand this problem.
仕事が終わったら帰ります (Shigoto ga owattara kaerimasu) - I will go home after work.

when_to_say: When talking about speaking or conversing
example: 日本語を話します (Nihongo o hanashimasu) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: When talking about making or creating something
example: ケーキを作ります (Keeki o tsukurimasu) - I make a cake.

meaning: To sleep, to go to bed
example: 毎晩9時に寝ます (Maiban 9-ji ni nemasu) - I sleep at 9 every night.

問題を考えます (Mondai o kangaemasu) - I think about the problem.
この問題を説明します (Kono mondai o setsumei shimasu) - I explain this problem.
